result.execSummary:
All charges against Dominic J Aversa in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dominic J Aversa is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Dominic J Aversa in court, in custody.  Attorney Rachel Marie Boaz in court for Dominic J Aversa. State moves to dismiss. Court so orders.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Copy of information provided to counsel who waives reading and enters a special pleas of not guilty and not guilty by mental disease or defect. Counsel requests Dr. Collins be appointed for evaluation.  The court will order a mental health evaluation in all 4 cases through Behavioral Consultants but will not request a specific doctor be assigned.
Waiver form on file. Court examines defendant, accepts said waiver and binds matter over for trial. State informs.

1:20 PM  (Cases called 21CF378; 21CF408; 22CF38; 22CF39)Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Dominic J Aversa appeared in court, in custody, telephonically from Winnebago Mental Health Institution, Attorney Rachel Marie Boaz appeared in court for Dominic J Aversa. Counsel and District Atty in receipt of the doctor's report. Defendant was found to be competent and there is no objection by Atty Boaz for the court to receive the report into evidence. Defense will not be contesting determination. State requests the court make finding of competency with no other testimony or evidence. Court gives finding that the defendant is competent.
Further proceedings scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Forwarded as document for review to Branch 3 clerk .
Forwarded to DHS.
Forwarded to Sheriff's
